Title: Object: Sagrada Familia (The Holy Family)
Description: The rest of the Holy Family on the flight into Egypt. c.1780-90 Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Mariano Salvador Maella
Curator's comments: Much better known as a painter and draughtsman, Maella's activity as a printmaker was negligible. This is the only etching Maella made and very few other impressions are known. Whereas is not possible to determine how many impressions were made, that so few are recorded suggests a very limited print run. Despite his fleeting engagement with printmaking, the composition and delicacy of the etching demonstrates his facility in this field. The print is technically close to those by artists who worked in his orbit including Ramón Bayeu y Subias and José del Castillo suggesting the environment encouraged him to make this print. A preparatory drawing in red chalk for the print survives in the Royal Palace, Madrid (see J. de la Mano, 'Mariano Salvador Maella (1739-1819). Catálogo razonado', Santander, 2011, II, no.VIII.26). Lit.: M.P. McDonald, exhib.cat., BM, London, `Renaissance to Goya: Prints and drawings from Spain`, 2012, fig.34, p.213.
Bibliographic references: Páez 1981-85 / Repertorio de Grabados Españoles en la Biblioteca Nacional (1278.1)
Exhibition history: 2012/13 Sept-Jan, London, British Museum, ‘Renaissance to Goya: Prints and Drawings from Spain’ 2013, Aug-Nov, Sydney, AGNSW, 'Renaissance to Goya' 2013-4, Dec-Mar, Santa Fe, New Mexico Museum of Modern Art, 'Renaissance to Goya'
